TopicTitle: It may have been said already...but

Articles.Content:
I was curious...I see where there are Lego type kits requested and all. But what I would be interested in would be parts and magnets.

Take the Vanilla KSP parts and print them all. Then in the valid attach points insert magnets. That would let you build with parts that are printed and 3D and let me goof off at work...*ahem* keep busy during off time.

Would be pretty snazzy. If this has been mentioned before, I apologize, and if it already exists...where would I get them?

If it's not a thing, Hey Squad...I know you linked up with some 3D printers before and all...would it be a possible thing?
It's definitely possible to do it yourself with minimal tools
I have been debating setting something up where I allow people to send me their craft files and in exchange for some money, I 3D print the craft.
What you're describing is model rockets minus the gunpowder, and I can say from personal experience, the gunpowder is the fun part (concerned mothers think differently).

I have been debating setting something up where I allow people to send me their craft files and in exchange for some money, I 3D print the craft.

Do it! 10 chars

Alternatively, send me your toys and I'll break them down, drill them out, and magnetize them like in the video I linked. I've done it before with miniatures, and I wouldn't mind doing it for KSP (albeit for a small fee)
